scenario.title: Changing Winds at the Farmers Market
scenario.context: A bustling farmers market on a sunny Saturday afternoon
scenario.description: Sarah, a vendor at the farmers market, is faced with a sudden change in her booth location due to an unexpected issue. Her longtime friend and fellow vendor, George, delivers the news.
scenario.speaker1_persona: Calm, understanding, and supportive, George is always there to lend a hand or offer advice.
scenario.speaker2_persona_1: High EQ - Sarah handles the news with grace, understanding the change is unavoidable and quickly thinks of a plan to adapt to the new location.
scenario.speaker2_persona_2: Low EQ - Sarah responds with immediate frustration, blaming George for the change and resisting any suggestions for how to adapt.
scenario.speaker2_persona_3: Low EQ - Sarah becomes overly anxious about the change, worrying about the potential negative impact on her business and unable to think clearly about how to adapt.
scenario.speaker2_persona_high: High EQ - Sarah handles the news with grace, understanding the change is unavoidable and quickly thinks of a plan to adapt to the new location.
scenario.speaker2_persona_low: Low EQ - Sarah becomes overly anxious about the change, worrying about the potential negative impact on her business and unable to think clearly about how to adapt.

conversation.speaker: speaker1
conversation.text: Sarah, there's been a bit of a hiccup. There's a problem with your usual spot, and they're asking us to move our booths.

conversation.speaker: speaker2
conversation.text: What? But I've been in that spot for years! This is so sudden.

conversation.speaker: speaker1
conversation.text: I know. It's frustrating, but apparently, there's a drainage issue. The new spot isn't that far, though.

conversation.speaker: speaker2
conversation.text: Well, there's nothing I can do about it now, is there? I guess I'll just have to adapt.

conversation.speaker: speaker1
conversation.text: That's the spirit, Sarah. I'll help you move your stuff, let's make the best of it.

conversation.speaker: speaker2
conversation.text: Thanks, George. You're right, we can turn this into an opportunity. Maybe the new location will bring in more customers.
